values:
22 days til i leave this island, 29 days til i fly to france.  to FRANCE.  i'm going to france. what?

i'll be in france for nearly 300 days... well, i'll be in europe for that long... and it'll all pass by in the blink of an eye.  but for now, it's monstrous.  HUGE. i'm losing my noodle. losing noodle.

of course, the losing of the brain might be due to the 52 hours that i worked from friday til yesterday, and the 3 that i worked this morning. or perhaps it's partially due to the lack of sleep that results from working 12-13 hours out of 24.

i know. i hear the wha-ambulance pulling up around the corner... but my body's telling me that it needs rest.  so i have two days off, one of which i intend to spend with the one and only michelle ralph, as she flies into and out of my life so quickly and randomly...  the other, may consist of more errands (they never end) and chores. eeeeeep. so little time.

but don't worry all, i'll see your faces at some point in the next year and a half for sure.  afterall, i'll be heading back to MUN in a year and a bit with the rest of yas.

loves yer faces. don't forget it.

holla atcha boi.

yis.

so anyway.  life's still sunshine-y. boys still happen to be pretty insignificant in the world on ern murp (which btw, i'm kinda getting used to...). also, i went for a walk last night and spam worms attacked me. it was terrifying.

AND one of the girls who i work with (one of the 2 who have more experience than me) just got offered a new job.  she starts on monday.  she has been working non-stop in the restaurant... so i suspect that i'll be working non-stop pretty soon.  i had my first "big group" experience today.  73 people in for soup and sandwiches.  two seperate kind of groups.  and the elderly group couldn't seem to remember what they ordered.

whoa. i was about to tell a really long story about soup and sandwiches... don't do that erin. don't be that waitress.

in other news. me and em went and saw "a prairie home companion" earlier this week.  and it was hilarious.  slightly bizarre, but worth a watch.

i'll leave you with my favorite* joke from the movie:  two penguins were standing on an ice flow. 1st penguin says to the other "you look like you're wearing a tuxedo."  2nd penguin replies "how do you know i'm not?"




*favorite doesn't mean funniest.  although i did laugh pretty hard and long at it.

school's out forever?  no... today, only for retired teachers and high school kids who won't go on to further their education.  

as for me, school's not really pertinent.  except that the restaurant where i work now (started "training" yesterday and made $40 in tips ~cha-ching~) will hopefully get busier... and by hopefully i mean, i'd like to have another shift or two to get my bearings before the place fills to capacity.  seems like a good crowd that i'm working with. i'm excited about the summer. working will be a good change. and if i does right good, i'll have a job guaranteed for next summer. whoot!

and about the rest of life?  well, leading up to my first day of work was an amazing stretch of fun-fulled days and nights.  including: jumping in puddles the size of ponds in my rubber boots, a trip to the beach - northern bay sands, salmonier nature park (we saw the meadow vole!), bbqed 'otdogs, board games, shopping, the hike around signal hill, long walks around downtown, and of course, laying out on my deck in the glorious sunshine.

life's alright ya know.  pretty fantastic all in all. i like it. i like it a lot. (and as papa john would say "those who like it, like it a lot. -i think he was quoting a commercial... sounds about right. "even the grapes?")

so, big event tomorrow night at o'brien's. so i get to dress all in black. hurrah!

it's june! holy 'mokes. 3 months of summer, 3 months of Canada left.

i know that if i blink i'm going to be looking out my apartment window in Nice thinking that it's only 3 months before i come back again... so i'm gonna try hard not to blink for the next year or so, so as to gain ample enjoyment from the moments as they pass.

for the record, i haven't started work yet, and i don't know when i will.

brother has been gone for a week and a half, which means he comes back in half a week for a few weeks before he goes again for more than a few weeks. (sidenote: on Lingo the other day a couple tried to use "W-H-E-E-K" as a word. i'm not sure whether that was before or after the other couple spelled "W-H-E-E-P". but in either case my mom and i nearly peed in our pants.)

so now i'm going to put on my pjs and climb the stairs to my loft. 

i am happy.

life is like a rollercoaster you know.  it really is.  and i like rollercoasters. but i wouldn't imagine that they're that fun when you're stomach sick, or have a really bad headache.

that's kinda how i feel about life being a rollercoaster right now. i feel like my stomach isn't strong enough to take it right now... or that my head might explode. 

i'm feeling critical, and moody beyond moody.  i don't even know where to begin to explain my moods. there are good things in my life right now. (ex. i have an interview with o'brien's on friday). but there are also things that make me go MARH (ex. boys who don't really care at all AND don't even pretend to.)

if i could send a telegram to him i would say: dear boy (stop) if you were to pretend that you cared i might want to see you (stop) as it is i would rather not (stop) ever again (stop) if you feel the need to see me again please bring flowers and stand outside my window with a 50 piece marching band (stop)  otherwise this is it (stop) thanks for nothin' (stop)

i guess it wouldn't be very sound of music-like, but the end result would be the same... singing about my favorite things with my 5 brothers and sisters.

i really thought it would be a lot easier than this...  living in the moment that is.  

don't look ahead too far, and live life day by day. i guess the problem comes in when you take that quick glance towards the future. you see an impending end...  would you rather know that the end is just around the corner? or be caught by surprise?  (i'm not talking about death... that's too morbid for a wednesday morning). 

you finally find someone that makes you happy, and while you know that it won't last forever... not even for more than a few months, how do you stop yourself from getting in deeper than you intended?

just for fun. just for the moment. taking it day by day... or date by date. no expectations and very few wishes. because it will be easier to let go when it does happen to end.  

and then you realise how quickly a moment passes.

how do you live in a moment when before you realise it's happening, it's gone?

it was a really good week. our house came together like never before. and we are all the better for it. i'm so proud of how much work we put in, and all we got out of it.

it just pains me to think about the hatin' that went on.  i'm not a hater (as much as michelle ralph might argue that i WAS the hater near central park), and i don't enjoy hate. whether it's towards me, or my friends, or people i know, or people i don't even want to know. there's no need for it. at all. (maybe that's a little bit of my dad coming through)... either way. as much as the week was good, it was painful. and in everything i do, i only speak for myself. and in anything i say that might be misconstrued, i say it in order to get a reaction. not a negative one. but just a few seconds of thought from the receiving end. of course, the world is not a perfect place, and i was caught in conversations that i would have preferred not to have had to even be a part of, but then i thought it was over. i mean, we were on the "losing end" of things right?  

so i thought it was over. but as i walked back from putting my tray back i hear an "in your face". and really. what's in my face? the fact that barnes house won winter carnival again? boy, i didn't lose anything. except the last 15 minutes of peace... interrupted. 

but now that i've raged, i'm good to go. all that nonsense is over in my mind. if only my mind was clear of nonsense.
but alas. it is my mind and inherently and eternally full of nonsense. 

so enough with barnes house hating loder, martin, & burke house. eff off. get over it. grow some sense. all we are saying is give peace a chance. ;)

i'm sitting in my brother's living room.  yes, it's my living room too, but he's the one who lives here for now.  and boy does he live here. quelle sorte de SLOB!  

i'm been surfing the interweb. looking at people's blogs etc., cause really, what else is there to do on friday evening?  

my answer will have to be: nothing.  because i need to relax, recupe, rejuve, unwind...  somehow the first two weeks back went downhill 3 days ago.  thinking back, i was having a deadly time.  smiling and dancing practically every step of the way.  of course it was all pretty much a dream. one of those dreams that you think is going to end so well, and then the plot twists and you wake up crying.

i am a very self-destructive person. especially when it comes to drinking* & boys. generally, i can handle drinking sans boys.  now, boys alone... i will not claim to have any control in this area.  because quite frankly, i don't.  my master plan A at the moment is to get a transfer to blackall and lock myself in my room except to eat, do bathroom type activities, and go to class. now, i already forsee a few problems with this plan. 1. i don't like girls. 2. i won't become any better with interacting with boys if i'm never around them. 3. i don't like blackall.

so there must be a plan B somewhere. yes. a less drastic plan in which i suck it up, and realise that it could be worse... i could actually live in blackall. B-B-B-L-A A-A-A-C-K A-A-A-L-L AAAAAY BLACKALL! 

barf.  and now. to commence relaxation.

-----
*drinking free booze - meaning booze that i do not pay for.

i've been studying for linguistics... and listening to super gold 60s on icebergradio.com  makes me really happy, and i find myself singing along.  which is fine cause it's not something that interupts my work... plus i'm smiling because the music is condusive to such facial expressions.

i reccommend it.

and that's all for now. studies await.

i dreamnt about an old lady who was drinking out of a yellow fire hydrant.  she had a couple of glasses of milk that she wanted me to hold while she took the cover off the hydrant, had her drink of water and replaced the cover again.  she thanked me and went on her way, with her two glasses of milk.

i woke up at 6:30 this morning, feeling like i should be getting out of bed.  which makes sense because i had been sleeping since 9ish.

craig told me a funny story about how i wanted him to take my glasses and put then in random places, and then get them for me again.  the retrieving part makes sense because i wouldn't have been able to find them in a sober state, let alone the state i found myself in last night.

if i'm not mistaken i still have make-up on my eyes, and that's why they're burning so badly right now.  so perhaps a shower is in order...

oh. and if you were wondering... RENT was AMAZING. i'll be going to see it again soon enough.

when everything takes a little more effort.
when my mind wanders to places that make me start to choke in a rushed effort not to cry because i'm sitting in the middle of a presentation in class.
when i start to remember again how things have changed forever.
when i see changes in myself that aren't really seen by anyone else because those who would have noticed are changing in the same ways.
when falling to sleep is a little harder and my dreams are more vivid and completely bizarre.
when i wake up in the middle of the night and pray that i've been trapped in an extensive dream for the last 2 and a half years.
when i expect people not to possibly even begin to understand the state of mind i find myself in, so i don't talk about it.
but also a time when i find myself telling stories that make people a little uncomfortable.

time does help. but it never goes away. and this time of year, memories become fresh, the will to have just one more day, one hour, one minute controls all other rational thoughts. 

and no one can make any of that go away.

when one is drunk, and in a big crowd, every second of every minute is utilised.  mostly used to say random things to random people. and then you spend hours (the next time you find yourself sober) trying to figure out if you really said all of those things. cause really, what would have possessed you to say half of that?

one answer comes to mind: alcohol.

some argue that alcohol is a truth serum.  but i'm not really sure that's true.  it definitely draws out some of your deepest thoughts, but i would like to point out the ridiculous number of your thoughts that carry no aspect of truth at all. often the things that rattle around in your cerebral area don't even pertain to your personal opinions. you give them no value, except that they're in existance... and that's about it.

if a person drinks and gets drunk at all, in their lifetime, they must understand that people cannot possibly apologise for every thing that comes out of their mouths.

perhaps i'll just throw out a big "sorry i drink and get drunk" out there into the universe... and an "i forgive everyone else who does too".

and now i'm going to maximize some of my time and write the rest of my history paper.

my brother, and two other pearsonites and i were walking down (or maybe up) duckworth, and we turned the corner and an old man was sitting there.

"i likes your hair."
"thanks."
"how do you wash it?"
"like a sponge, soap in, soap out."
"how often?"
"once a week."
"like ya should."
"mmm hmm."
"have a good night."
"you too."

i figure once my dreadies are gone i will be able to continue to live vicariously through my brother's conversations with random strangers. i figure by now i've had my share of middle-aged women looking at me with envy, and old women scowling at me... and hair won't be such a bad thing.  it might even make me look older than 13. wouldn't THAT be nice.

reilly and i corresponded, and i've gotten over my immediate spite towards barnes house. however, it seems to be a recurring emotion, so don't hold your breath.

i have a history paper to write before i go to bc.  eek. i'm going to bc in a week. i'll be flying over eastern canada in exactly a week. holy eff. can't even being to explain how excited i am about being on vancouver island again.

nor can i explain how frustrated resnet makes me.  disconnected 4 times since i started writing this post.  bleh!

not gonna get into specifics of why i feel so strongly about this sentiment right now. but alls i got to say is barnes house=stupid and ugly. 

mixer crawl on friday was DEADLY. me and the girls (lesbee, twins & mack) did the santa DRUNK fairy thing and we had a blast.  and we won.  but that's neither here nor there.

so because of how awesome friday was i decided not to bother with saturday at all. cause i knew i couldn't beat it and i spent a stupid amount of money on friday... 

got some french to catch up on. i shall catch up with livejournaling at a later date.

out.

and neglecting the french-work that i got up to do this morning.

it's monday again... and the week is stretching out ahead of me. and somehow i know that there aren't enough hours to get everything done that i should.  c'est ennervant.  or some random french word that half of you won't understand anyway.

i've been practicing zoo-y activities lately and quite frankly i'm disturbing myself. i think perhaps i'll become a hermit and stop drinking all together. (i punched a guy in the face saturday night).

ANYWAY. life is dandy, and i have a french essay to write later this afternoon in my prof's office. i think i might puke. good plan? YES.

living life...

the long weekend ruined me.

i don't want to walk to class, i don't want to sit in class, i don't want to listen once in class, and i'll be damned if i want to do any thinking about what my profs say to me in class.

and i don't really want to be here in my room.  uh oh.  i've got a bad case of the "don't wanna"s.  perhaps i've taken a trip back to my early childhood... speaking of which. matthew said that i was one of those kids whose parents hoped would turn out better than they started,  i think he actually used the word "ugly".  harumph. i shall show him pictures of the beautiful child that i was later on. and then gloat. because i was.  

i mean, i'm not saying i was a beautiful pre-teen... cause really, who was?

um. yeah. so life hey?
 
i'm going to bc in november... and i'm mega pumped about it. can't wait, one might say. and time for class. bah humbug.

and not a boyfriend in sight.

but you won't find me complaining more than a couple times a week.  cause you see, the potentials that i seem to find, are less than up to par. (truth be told).  i mean. i guess they are. i just seem to pick the ones who aren't looking for anything remotely serious, or the ones who think that i'm fantastic... granted there's only been one of those lately. and he freaked the poo out of me.

then there's all my future husbands.  great guys who at some point in my life i could see being a great fixture in my life. but i know myself. and i know that right now there are certain kinds of people who don't quite fit the mold... and that's unfortunate for me. but well, i don't know. i guess i need to just throw haste into the wind and...  nevermind i can't possibly think of where that could go.

so. i'm thinking about just declaring myself an old maid right now.  i mean, it's just as well. in the meantime i'm gonna have myself some fun, and keep my eyes open.  like ya would.

schmeh.

back in burke... of course i'd have to be by now.  i've been neglecting all sorts of online things... like emails to friends in far off countries... and livejournal.

i have however played an amazing amount of texttwist. yes texttwist. 

in other news. raylene and i came second in the burke house frisbee tag tournament... having played in only half of the games...  who'd have guessed?!  "not i," said the duck. 

classes are going well, i'm loving being back in here... and i think maybe brother is going to take me out for supper on sunday.  life is good. i'm happy.

and i realised that i'm growing and healing day by day, because it's now on the happy days that i miss papa john the most. that's gotta count for something right?

in any case. i love carpet. (that's what i'd tell hot johnny if he were to ask how i felt about carpet.)

i haven't slept much... and now michelle's gone away.  like far far away to nanaimo. well, she's at least halfway now.

AND i have to go to mun today and stand in line for an effin' parking permit.  AND yeah.  i'm not sure there was another and.  

brother bear got up to go to school this morning, and there was so much stuff in my room that i didn't bother to close my door when i went to bed and it was the first time since being here that i woke up before my body thought it was time to wake up.  and then i was restlessly sleeping, and i think i had a few weird dreams... and now i'm just up.

so.  i would like to recognise right now that i type "and" and "so" a lot to introduce new things into my paragraphs, or into my life...  ish.  right.  huh.  weird.

after we left micha at the airport peter and i went up to signal hill.  he had never been there before and i figured he was in just the right mood to look down at st. john's... and i was right. he said something amazing on the drive from the airport. it was something like "this is the end of a chapter. and camp was just the prologue.  i really hope there's a lot of chapters yet to come."  i didn't even want to barf after he said that.  crazy right?  

so, res soon.  i'm pumped. mega-like.

let's start off by saying that i SHOULD have capitalized "newsflash" and put an exclamation mark after it.  cause i think what i have to say is rather substantial news. indeed.

ahem.  ladies and gentlemen, i have made a discovery. this summer, summer 2005, i grew a bum.

you may all quietly return to what you were doing. me and my bum are going to hang out for awhile.  maybe indefinitely... 

and if you want to stick around for a few more lines, my bum and i will explain to those of you who may be confused what the big deal is about.  well you see, i've been accused of not having a bum for many years. and in fact the one that i grew is probably smaller than most bums out there. BUT. (hehe) when i put on my pants now, they go "ooh my, little tougher getting up around there."  and i'm not complaining of not fitting in my clothing, cause that's something that i keep for my private affairs- not this online open to the world nonsense- i'm just letting you know that i do indeed have more of a bum than yesterseason.

and may i say that my dear friend anders is flying in tomorrow afternoon.  i'm pumped.  i love life. and lamp.

it's 12:15am... and i went to sleep after going to c'ville with mama 4pm-ish.  before that i guess i slept for a few hours last night... maybe.

i went up to visit my favorite place on earth - burry heights- thursday night. went and saw a lot of kids that it took awhile to recognise, and some of my favorites from years gone past. jessica ash and johnny butt being top two there. so i pulled an all nighter the first night. i just wasn't tired. i was CRAZY, but not tired. and i slept for 15 minutes intervals 3 or 4 times throughout that day.  so miss narcolept was a little tired today. and drove home well enough this afternoon... now the challenge is to find decent sleep sometime soon and not wake up at 5am. i'm kind of lucky that brady jumped on me and threw his water bowl at me. otherwise i would've just been wide awake at 3am.  that would've been a drag-ola. 

so camp though,  amazing.  i realise that moosquid is a very different individual... different from erin and tibby.  and no.  i'm not suffering from multiple personality disorder, at least not that this erin's aware of. BUT moosquid is a lot more crazy than my other camp personas. i was yelling random words at the kids and it appeared that it wasn't the first time that i had done this cause they laughed and smiled in a knowing way. hmm.

got some of the best warm fuzzies of life thursday night. it's really nice to get life-love. what?  okay perhaps sleep should be a sooner rather than later thing.

respect.

so i just walked up to signal hill (full tilt). and when i got there i sat and tried to find my house.  but i got distracted by three blond children who were chanting "castle! castle!"  and after i was done smiling at them i started thinking about how st. john's is my unofficial home.  i say this because i haven't been home to lethbridge yet.  not only that, but i haven't seen my doggies yet. and that's HUGE. so sitting there, i was thinking a thousand thoughts one of which was how sweaty i was, and how it wasn't windy up there like it almost always is.

so i'm sitting here, still sweaty and smelly... and i just received an email from a boy that i met this summer. and well... i don't know. life's a little too complicated sometimes isn't it? not really complicated at all, but we can convince ourselves that really it's SO complex that we're not sure what to do.  the answer to which is usually a big fat "nothing" because there's nothing to deal with at that exact moment.

and now i'm going to go take a shower and curl up on my leather sofa with WICKED... and forget about the non-existant complications of my life for awhile.

i feel perhaps that my goal of letting the world know what i was up to was a little far-fetched for this summer...

but now i'm back in newfoundland and i have ample time to hide from the real world and indulge in the not-so-real world online.

so what did you do this summer erin? -lots.  

i went to new york city... that's the last thing i remember doing... and well. that's all i got.

see the thing is... wherever it is, i'm pretty sure i'm not in it.  it being the loop.

i've been in camp mode.  and i guess i still am in camp mode.  but the rest of the world is not in existence... not to me anyway.

saralynn: did you get into education?
matthew: why are you shaving your legs?
emily: how goes the packing trials?
rayray: welcome aboard... another letter is coming your way.

all the rest: what am i supposed to say that applies to everyone? pshaw

i'll be home in two weeks and a bit.  and that scares me.  hold my hand please. i'll see you soon?

right.  thirteen year olds are making me crazy.

love love love...

our flag is flying today.  thanks goodness.  cause i need to get rested up cause the 4th of july is very soon.

my girls in my cabin (13 year olds) call me tibby.  that's my name in bunk 20A. they ask who "erin" is whenever someone comes by and says hello.  oh dear dear me.  where is my identity going?

what else can i tell you?  i climbed a climbing wall for the first time ever. and i've hiked to the top of two mountains.  and i've been playing lots of sports that i've never really played before... like lacrosse, and soccer...  but they're not gonna make me play tennis which is a very very good thing. 

um.  okay. so that's basically all i'm willing to disclose.  i miss you all, well, a little bit.  but that's cool.

muchas love.

here i am world. 

i've been here. and i love love love it.

more later. i really don't have time.  and i'm sorry, but well. that's how this summer is turning out to be.

but i'm going to be happy and i'll write about stories later.
there's 7 newfs here.

life is good.

out.

i'm in boston. at a hostel. and i have less than 3 minutes to tell you a story.

i'm going to camp today.

i threw out a pair of old navy flip flops today because while walking down the street i stepped on something that made me go "%^&*#"

any guesses as to what it was?
.
and no, it's not dog poo. i would wash off dog poo.  be more imaginative.

so camp walt whitman here i come.  someone write me an email! please?!

love love love to you all.

guess away, this'll be fun

and here is what she wrote: A black and white cow turned on we.

i think i might just have to laugh at that for a few weeks now. 

i've been helping aunt x2 and mom with the cleaning out of nan's house. it's been decent, but the dust has my sinuses screaming for clean air.

in search of such air, i went for a walk to "my" beach this afternoon. and there's really nothing like a walk on a familiar beach to bring back buried memories. memories of winter, spring, summer, and fall. remembering mine and amy's promise that we'd climb the rock face (that looks much less steep now than back then), memories of canoeing with dad and ryan, thinking about the week before i went off to pearson when i'd slip down to the beach at night and think about how huge the universe was (and how relatively insignificant i was), going to see the tin man, and of just last summer when i took alex and amanda to see the place that was my home.  and then i looked up at the house that i lived in for 17 years. and do you know what they did?!  they put a roof over the patio! how am i supposed to sun bathe there?  

i know. i quickly realised that it wasn't my house anymore. i didn't look up and see dad on the patio checking to see that i didn't throw myself into the ocean as i was skipping rocks. there was no brady, no tara outside barking. and life goes on. places change ever so slightly while we're looking in the opposite direction. 

you'll all be happy to hear that the window that i broke when playing catch with my brother 15 or so years ago is still there... i had bad aim when i got spitey. okay. i had bad aim all the time, and when i was spitey i threw things hard enough to break the basement window. oops.

so. a massive trip down memory lane was how i spent this saturday. hope everyone is being half as productive.

6 days til blast-off.

holy guacamole. i have to PACK!  i have to find a flashlight. and i have to calm down!

i just had a crazy zoo-y cry for myself. hadn't cried in awhile and mom and i had a chat that was not related at all to me crying. i think i was in the sun for too long. she seemed worried about me. and i was fine as far as i could tell. just crying. 

hehehehehe. jeff just called roller coasters "bazoomies".  that's funny. hehehehe.

um. i broke the clothesline today. mom asked if i put too much clothes on it.  and i said "i guess so."  and then she asked if i put heavy clothes on it. and i said "i guess so."  i mean. the part of the shed that it was screwed into just fell off the shed.  it was quite an event.

i want to go on lingo. some of the people on that show are really dumb. i could beat their asses any day. who's with me?

so it's finally over - my mom's kindergarten graduation... she didn't graduate yet. she's still got 3 more years.  but i'm done with helping for another year.  and i might reconsider helping next year.  NO. wait.  mr. walsh (the principal) is going back to clarenville next year... so he won't thank me 10 times, and call me up in front of the parents and give me flowers.  yes. i'm so embarrassed.  i was just helping my mom. (minding my own business -we know what that means right wesbee?) so my cheeks are still red.  it's more than an hour after the fact.  and i can feel them burning.  which just goes to show you SL, i'm easily flushed. not just in dining hall.

9 days before i fly to boston.  oh i'm so excited. it's going to be somethin' wicked. buddy. 

what else is worth sharing?  um... well.  OOH!  i found these wicked tuned percussion tube-y thing-ies.  they are SO much fun.  i was playing with them while the kids came in tonight... mom made me stop playing way too quickly, but man oh man, i had fun while it lasted.  yes.  i'm a child.  but what odds!

hoping to sleep-in tomorrow.  we'll see what 'appens. eh girl?

he woke me up to get a head-start on the day.  i guess i'll have to be nice to him.  silly dog.

mama's watching maury "paternity tests revealed...cheaters exposed!"  and it's ridiculous. some girl was throwing chairs. i laughed.

ryan thinks our family should go on dr. phil.  i think it would be funny. mostly because i don't see dr. phil saying much to me about anything.  so go for it eh b'y?

i love oranges. mmmmm, oranges.

where's lesbee-anne? why isn't she coming to visit me? i'm leaving soon. the 16th to be exact.

i had a lovely visit in town with matthew, mackenzie, amy, and critchy. (among other very brief visits.) and am hoping to be able to stay in my house the next time i come in... (that would be nice)

anywho! c'est tout.

in glovertown wha?  some fun eh b'y?  ya knows.

we went for a walk.  around the "steady"  whatever that means.   we're going to gander ce soir pour boire un peu d'alcool (is that spelled right?)  oh dear.

ANYWAY.  it's a gorgeous day out. and i actually got warm and had to take off my zip-up.  it was a big thing.  i've been frozen ever since i got back from jamaica. 

yesterday i helped mom some more with her kindergarten graduation stuff.  and monday i spent the whole day there with the lovely little 5 year olds.  they're fun hey? well, the first class was fun, the afternoon class was uninspiring. kids can be really dull you know! but it's amazing how different two groups of kids can be.  anyway. i'm being dull now.

going to st. john's tomorrow. so, if i don't call you. call me.  cell number as usual. i'll take you on a tour, to the yellow house. :)

murphy out.

it's cold here.  in my house. 

my feet are freezing, but i refuse to put on socks.

paul and mom are eating lobster. 

my brother and i own a house. 27 bannerman st. it's yellow. you can come visit if you want.

jamaica was fantastic. everything i could've hoped for. i miss the fruit, and jo's friends and family. and the warmth.

maggie was here today. i looked through my jamaica pics for the first time.  it was so green there. (sigh)

alright, enough. i'm distressed...

come again when i'm in newfoundland... but not in newfoundland. here in jamaica.  because, well. i don't think you like me very much. and i'd like to be proven wrong. please.

so i have to fly out tomorrow. :( that makes me sad.  back to canada... away from the dancing boys and incredibly relaxed attitudes... boy. i can't wait.

we went out last night for supper.  mmm.  and. then we went out to a club.  good times.  i didn't recognise any of the music for a while. it was old school "dancehall" music... which translates into jamaican music from the 90s.  so obviously erin doesn't know it.  uh huh.

um.  what else?  oh yeah... we went to ocho rios yesterday. and when we got to the beach it rained. mmm hmm. murphy's law strikes again. whoop whoop.

so emily... when am i coming to visit? let's go to eastport or something stupid like that.  (wait.  it's may there isn't it...) fook. well, we'll do something, and it may or may not be fun...

okay. i'm outie. one love.

i've trained my ear enough to the jamaican "patois"ish accent that when i hear "empress" or "rasta girl" that i know to acknowledge (or not) the guy who seems to have the need to call to me.

empress is a term used for any girl who seems to uphold or lean towards upholding a part of the rastafarian faith.  and since i have dreads, i'm one of them.

so we went to the national gallery.  and on the way up the street to the gallery a guy started calling out "whitey..."(which may have been because i was wearing a white shirt... cause angela is also white ya know), "empress!" and other things that i couldn't quite understand.  but i knew he was talking to me, so i just kinda looked and nodded and ducked into the national gallery (which is the art gallery).  guess what?  he followed us in.  he was so taken by me that he, for the first time in his many years working construction downtown right near the gallery, he paid the next to nothing admission fee and came into the museum.  and although he was a seemingly very nice guy, i didn't understand much that he said.  so he conversed with jo... telling her that i was beautiful, and natural and all kinds of nonsense like that.  and he was heart broken that he couldn't talk to me.  i'm sure i might have tried talking to him if i thought i'd be saying much more than: "what?! ...come again? ...huh?"  so i've cultured one rasta man today.  what shall i do tomorrow?

we might be going out, painting the town red, tonight.  but it's been raining, so there's only one club that's inside that we'd be going to.  can you imagine? all the hot clubs are outdoor venues.  WTF? never would work in newfoundland eh?

herm.  what else?  oh.  mama phoned me today. on jo's cell, we were in the car on the way to the gallery.  it was bizarre... but i realise that i miss my mommy, and i'm glad she called.  it gives me incentive to go home at some point. otherwise i'd hide from the government officials and live here forever and ever. 

with that said.  i'm tired. and looking more tanned as days go by.  ~4 days left.  let them crawl by slowly please. 

out.

going up to "portland"  which should not be confused with any portland that you are aware of.  like the one next to brooklyn, which is next to lethbridge, and on the other side of that portland is jamestown.  god, i don't miss home at all.

anyway.  going to port antonio.  going to a beach or two.  gonna eat jerk.  and work some more on this tan of mine.  and hopefully see a waterfall or two. and go to the blue lagoon.  where the movie blue lagoon was filmed.  how 'bout that!

woke up at an ungodly hour to take jo's sister to the airport.  saw an unimpressive sunrise and a naked man walking along the side of the road.  good times.

hope everyone's healthy and happy.

and pat, there will be pictures to share via my msn space once i get back to the rock.  

alright.  me talk to youse later on.

there are mosquitos around the computer.  always around the computer... never anywhere else.

and as i sit here admiring my tan... i think: "well that's enough"

peace love and happiness to you all. :P

so apparently [straight]boys are not only capable of dancing-  but enjoy dancing, and do it willingly all by themselves.  sometimes groups of boys.  with girls looking on.  uh huh.  it happens. it's not just something from that the popular media made up.  who woulda thunk it? (and for the record... it's hot.)

jo's yard has enough bearing fruit trees to be considered a farm.  granted i think the magic number is somewhere around 10.  but just think about it... that's a helluvalot of fruit. mmmm.  fruit.

and my feet are disgusting.  covered in mosquito bites. and maybe ant bites too. we're not sure.  but they tell me that i must be allergic to them. i'm hoping that they're allergic to me too... and suffering. hard.

planning on getting some more hardcore color.  mmm.  color. (the magic color being brown).

i'm sticky, and happy.  and if my feet weren't so itchy at night i'd be incredibly rested right now,  for now i'm just rested. :)

oh!  i went to the bob marley museum on hope road today.  amazing. well.  amazing for me.  right?  :) i was happy.  and i saw where he slept, and recorded music, and chilled out... and played football (which for you north americans is soccer).

alright enough for now.

i have arrived.

(right now i have to go poo, but jo's in the bathroom)

it's raining au moment.  and it's sticky and warm, and for the record: i love it.

went to a party last night.  twas un peu bizarre, but, well, i'm in a different country and culture shock is something that goes with unless you go and plunk yourself down on a resort away from culture... 

my friend's family is awesome.  she told me that we must be a hit cause her mom was making breakfast.  

there are little ants everywhere, and lizards that climb over the walls.  and there was a frickin' huge moth in my (jo's) room last night. (for those of you who don't know, i'm afraid of moths.  and dead insects.)  so i said to angela "i'm going to close my eyes and pretend that it's a cow being electrocuted."  we laughed for a long time.  and i'm still not sure where that thought came from. and guess what?!  there's little lizards.  and they climb over the walls and ceiling. it's wicked!

food's good.  although i'm on an island, and island people like seafood.  i shall survive if only on fruit alone. :)

the rain's let up. i guess we're pool party bound.

love to you all.

everywhere.  it's grey and cold outside. and spring's not quite here, and we're not together.

my brother and i have had an excellent visit together consisting of television, fudge, and ...that's all i remember.

so jamaica awaits me. 10 glorious days in the sunshine (and apparently thunder showers says TheWN), time to relax and groove to some reggae music whenever possible.

my travelling companion, angela, and i have decided to tell the nice people at air canada that we want to be seated together, but we both want window seats.  hehe.  decided to be difficult and amusing.  good plan eh?  

saralynn keeps calling me a bitchface. i'm going to assume that it's a term of endearment, like all my "bitch, slut, whore" remarks.  so thanks sl. i love you too.

so to toronto to stay with my cousin donna et famille, i go.  should be fun.  i enjoy seeing her kids, and her.  she's got amazing amounts of life. one of my favorite relatives i think.


if i don't update for awhile it means i'm way too busy having a load of laughs... and if i do update, it means that i have an addiction to communication.  i'll have to sort that out at some point in the future.

a university town at its best.  really pretty for those of you who haven't seen it... and well, really empty after winter semester's done.   so here i sit in the library, using up some precious mount allison computer time...

i saw my murphy relatives monday and yesterday.  they came down for brother's convocation. really good to see them. ryan's currently in PEI, he's coming back to sackville today. are we ready for some intense brother/sister quality time?  maybe...

the appartment i'm staying in has TBS and a dvd player. so i'm set.  i watched wimbledon and some other dumb movie last night. and american idol and amazing race.  i'm such a junkie. i wouldn't watch tv if it weren't there... and it wouldn't bother me.  but since it is there, there i am.

nobody's online this morning.  (i'm not surprised)  but c'mon, the library isn't open at midnight... or past 4:30pm for that matter.

so... jamaica in 2!  whoop whoop.  good morning sunshine.  here comes the sun. sunshine lollipops and... oh mister sun, sun, mister golden sun.

oh, and fancy.  (look there you are!)  i don't remember the site of your blog.  it would be oh so much easier if you had a livejournal i figure. ;)  hehe

alright. this is murphy... saying i miss my friends today, and i'll miss them tomorrow, but on friday... it's all over and the sunshine will take away all my worries.  and you can miss me! and be jealous of me.  and that's cool right?  YIS ya KNOWS!

okay.  murphy, out.

my aunt marnie was talking about how life wasn't fair...  she said that we should all have a check out date. that we should know when our time was going to be up.  (right away i was filled with a silent horror, imagine the days leading up to it... i guess they could be fantastic, but what if you're all alone leading up to the expiration date  and you KNOW...)

then aunt lois piped up and said that maybe if it was: no one could die before they're 65, but if you take care of yourself you can live longer.  their dad died when he was 58, mine when he was 48, nan was almost 77. we're all still dealing with the injustice that was our fathers' deaths. 

but then aunt lois was musing some more.  she said that there are definitely worse things in life than death.  and i completely agree. watching someone suffer brings the will for it to be over. and i didn't believe that that was possible.  that you would want someone to die...  until i saw it for myself. my dad was suffering. i secretly hoped that it would be over before too long.  and i felt guilty.  but i understand more now. life is sometimes over-rated if you can't LIVE.

the holes that are left in your heart, in your being, by those who go on before you... they can sometimes be filled in part by those who are yet to enter your life. (at least that's what i'm banking on)... but even if they go unfilled - i'm so much more whole because of my family, living and dead.

i don't believe that life is fair, and i'm not sure what the whole idea is, but i suspect that it doesn't much matter.  cause ob-la-di ob-la-da life goes on...

it's funny, i probably wouldn't tell anyone if i didn't have this method of communication.

my nan (mom's mom) died this morning.

we're all keeping busy. i'm not sure i really realise that she's gone. she made me a cake for my birthday less than a week ago.  so it wasn't really an expected thing... although, she wasn't a well woman, she lived at home alone and i'm pretty sure she went shopping in clarenville yesterday.

she told me on sunday that she hoped she would be well enough to bake me a cake for my next birthday...

and there's nothing left to say right now.

oh. except that i'll be going to sackville on monday instead of sunday (when i'll be attending the funeral).

-out

so i woke up at like 5am this morning. feeling yucky.

i've kinda gotten over that.... just got off the phone with my darling angela (from cornerbrook who's going to jamaica with me in *GASP* 11 days) and am uber happy about sunshine. mmmmm sunshine.

BUT! bad news bears! i might not be driving to the states! *gasp* *choke* *cough* *wheeze*

the schtupid insurance company wish not to insure someone (namely me) who goes to the states for work purposes. granted, if i was going on an extended roadtrip all around the states, cool, badabing! i'm insured.  but instead.  badadoom... i'm working for two months down there, parking the car... and no insurance pour moi.  as of right now anyway.  (sigh) such disappointment in the air.

off to see the lawyer about money and house things. 
lovely day...  i'm out.

that i could pretend that i'm posting at any point in time.  i could just change the date and mess everything up.  that would be fun wouldn't it?  *slash/pointless.

so. sing me a song and make the sunshine brighter.  where is the sun? it's grey today. and my living room is occupied by a sleeping o'brien.  so brother bear and i are locked up in mama's room with the computer and the cosby show (at the moment)... good times wha?  i mean, it's almost 2:00, and there's no sign of life down there. bizarre.

i should go for a walk or something. i have to take porkchops out for supper.  ryan and i don't eat porkchops. but i guess these things matter less and less with the increasing O's in the house...

doo dee doo. later days.

the beginning of the end...  or something like that.

i'm home in lethbridge now. with paul-o and mama and ryan... and paul's eldest son mark was here, but left to see his friends a little while ago.  oh, and the dogs are here too.

mom and ryan are putting together a new bbq. i remember the first bbq my mom put together... she said something like "who needs a man?!" once it was done.  i think she had to try three or four times to get it right, but she did it.  (i was proud of her).

my room is chaulked full of my stuff, and mom's stuff and some of ryan's stuff.  i'm not quite sure how my room ended up being a storage room, but it is.  mom informed me today that my room is going to be gutted while i'm gone this summer, so i might as well do it myself and make my own decisions on what to keep.  so i've already started sorting through things.  i'm a packrat, and i come by it honestly...

anyway. it's time to get off my arse and do something. maybe make some phonecalls to long-lost friends... or something.

all for now folks...
